title: Not your key not your BTC
author: Not your key not your BTC
content: I am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----

comments.author: Kevystia
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Is it really you, Satoshi? Why are you hiding your identity from us? We want to know you, we want to marry you! ðŸ˜‚

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Verification Failed!I thought the Satoshi Nakamoto secret would last forever...anti climax much  Well, folks, it was fun while it lasted. I'm off to make my shortstack of pancakes while I wait for the feds to go try seize and domp that 1 million btc.Rarnn satoshi, rarnn!

comments.body: Hey Satoshi, weâ€™ve got a message for you  here - how about dropping a little chunk of your holdings for us?

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Lolz, are you guys really believing this guy here to be the real Satoshi, or are you all a joke?OK, this is amazing, while I intended typing the above as a way of countering the believe here, I actually decided to take out some time to do a research on the address the message was signed from, and behold, it's actually the same address that hold the bitcoins belonging to Satoshi nakamoto...Wow, just wow ðŸ˜²ðŸ˜²@satoshi, where have you been all this while? And why didn't you post from your initial bitcointalk account?

comments.author: Not your key not your BTC
comments.body: i created this thread to emphasize the title, not the satoshi. I am surprise someone like lovemaysfamilis mentioned me as impersonateÂ  Satoshi. Damn where is the brain.

comments.author: Amphenomenon
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Fake https://www.talkimg.com/images/2024/10/23/KCbfW.jpegI would say it has been quite a long time a troll got me this piss, to be honest.But also I hate the fact that some of took this as a joke and acted as if it was real (I might be wrong that some of you didn't know if it was real or not) there could have been others who would have believed this joke as real.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 02:50:35 PMi created this thread to emphasize the title, not the satoshi. I am surprise someone like lovemaysfamilis mentioned me as impersonate Â Satoshi. Damn where is the brain. I gifted you with a red flag because you tried to impersonate someone I believe made a big change in how we thought in our financial institutions as in the banks. I would love to hear from the original guy who holds this alt account and is trying to act smart by confusing the newbies who might think this might be the original Satoshi. If you have any issues then contact me by replying to my reply as I want to decimate you and the reason being you are a fake. I would love to see a new topic created by you on the reputation board about me as it will help me in going deep in your past

comments.author: Z_MBFM
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Signature invalid. there is no way anyone can hack it and validate an invalid digital signature of a Bitcoin address. an address can only be signed by someone who has the address's private key. For this reason, to verify the ownership of an account on this forum, it is also asked to sign the message of the Bitcoin address used in that account.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: The real Satoshi would not want to prove to us that he's the real Satoshi. In fact I don't think the real Satoshi would return to the forum. He's grown bigger than it. Lest I forget, we are all Satoshi. We share and believe in his dream for Bitcoin and that's why we bought into it. A little piece of him lives in each of us. Quote from: Sanitough on October 23, 2024, 01:56:40 PMHey Satoshi, weâ€™ve got a message for you  here - how about dropping a little chunk of your holdings for us?Nice one  This gave me a good laugh.

comments.author: bigmanik
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----This legit has to be one of the fastest way to get yourself a red tagWhy would you impersonate our hero and the fact that some of you played along Well I have to be honest you really did fool me at first But please don't do this again

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: bigmanik on October 23, 2024, 07:33:07 PMThis legit has to be one of the fastest way to get yourself a red tagWhy would you impersonate our hero and the fact that some of you played along Well I have to be honest you really did fool me at first But please don't do this againHe was probably trying to look for attention, now he got it. I can see a couple of DT members have already sent out tags to him and getting rid of them is going to be close to impossibleÂ  He should have tried to impersonate Craig Wright, maybe. There are some things you just can't keep joking about, especially when there are so many frauds out there claiming to be Satoshi Nakamoto.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on October 23, 2024, 09:14:52 PMQuote from: bigmanik on October 23, 2024, 07:33:07 PMThis legit has to be one of the fastest way to get yourself a red tagWhy would you impersonate our hero and the fact that some of you played along Well I have to be honest you really did fool me at first But please don't do this againHe was probably trying to look for attention, now he got it. I can see a couple of DT members have already sent out tags to him and getting rid of them is going to be close to impossibleÂ  He should have tried to impersonate Craig Wright, maybe. There are some things you just can't keep joking about, especially when there are so many frauds out there claiming to be Satoshi Nakamoto.In defense of the OP, we are all satoshi. However, the signed message is a bit much. This could just be a funny joke. If the OP is just spreading the word of satoshi it is probably harmless. I wouldnâ€™t go buying any NFTs or Ordinals from him anytime soon though. Clearly OP is not the creator of Bitcoin.

comments.author: Questat
comments.body: Quote from: BlackHatCoiner on October 23, 2024, 02:08:59 PMQuote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Quoted and not verified. Just because it looks real, we should just jump believing on it. We need to verify it at least. And based on my research, this is just another way to fool us. Nothing's new with this. But for those who fall for this trick, just fall for it but never put all your hopes high. The real Satoshi won't definitely steal our attention if ever he plans to come back, but will do it secretly and cautiously.

I am surprise someone like lovemaysfamilis mentioned me as impersonate Â Satoshi. Damn where is the brain. Because we all know about this already. Dumb to start yet another thread amidst the hundreds or even thousands of threads that already touch upon this subject.Quote from: OgNasty on October 23, 2024, 09:19:25 PMHowever, the signed message is a bit much. Its not a "signed message." Its nothing at all.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: OP, so you created this thread to get some attention and that's what you wanted right? You got some replies in your thread but you aren't Satoshi and anyone who even thinks that you're Satoshi then they are either joking or they are out of their mind. Satoshi Nakamoto left Bitcoin for the community and I believe he/she/they will never come back and claim him/her/them as Satoshi.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 10:27:38 AMI am the real Satoshi Nakamoto, and I will sign a message to prove it.Code:-----BEGIN BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----I am Satoshi Nakamoto today: October 23, 2024, 10:18:55 AM-----BEGIN SIGNATURE-----1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaIHJK0z1jiPpdesrfT4p1uTx9WLderffgrThhajs0mjHBwlQMc4OMbWp52hshnhtywioKl9Ehd D6pulL7k=-----END BITCOIN SIGNED MESSAGE-----Would that be all? We arenâ€™t born at the moment to just easily believe and get convinced on what you are trying to show to us. If this is real, then I donâ€™t think Satoshi will publicize it, but more likely keep it as a secret. Because he knows what anonymity means for bitcoin, and for all of us here whoâ€™s being anonymous simply becomes a big asset rather than a liability.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Not your key not your BTC on October 23, 2024, 02:50:35 PMi created this thread to emphasize the title, not the satoshi.Allow me to quote myself here:Quote from: LoyceV on October 24, 2024, 07:02:19 AMQuote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 23, 2024, 01:44:00 PMÂ Â Â Not your key not your BTCThis one stands out: it's a user who earned enough Merit to not be a shitposter. My first thought was another useless topic, but I think he's trying to make a point. Read the title: Don't Trust, Verify. That's like me telling you to download electrum.exe from my server, which I posted years ago.@Charles-Tim who tagged him: I think you missed the point of his topic. It's not the best way while so many people claim the same BS, but I don't think he had bad intentions.
